data.overview: Fortinet delivered a strong Q2 with total billings up 15% to $1.78 billion and revenue up 14% to $1.63 billion, beating billings and operating‑margin guidance; non‑GAAP operating margin was 33.1% and total gross margin was 81.6%. Momentum was driven by large enterprise expansion (deals > $1 million: +29% in number, +51% in value) and high‑growth software businesses: Unified SASE now represents 24% of billings (Unified SASE ARR $1.15 billion, +22%) and SecOps 11% of billings (ARR $463 million, +35%), with FortiSASE/SSE ARR >100% and 13% of large enterprises having purchased FortiSASE; product revenue was $509 million and service revenue was $1.12 billion. RPO totaled $6.64 billion (current RPO $3.45 billion); adjusted free cash flow was $428 million in the quarter ($1.27 billion YTD); infrastructure investments were $168 million in Q2, and the company repurchased ~4.6 million shares for $401 million. In the Q&A management emphasized that SASE is additive not cannibalistic to firewalls (over 90% of SASE customers are existing firewall customers), the 2026 firewall refresh cycle is ~40%–50% complete, OT is growing >20% globally, sovereign SASE and owned infrastructure are strategic differentiators, and go‑to‑market/channel incentives are aligned to multi‑product adoption and upsell.
